Articles.Content:
As my new avatar and rank show, I have developed a love for vintage planes, namely early biplanes and triplanes from WWI and before. Many of the craft I build are modeled after this style.

I haven't seen a showcase thread for this subject yet, so I decided to make one myself.

Show us your biplanes, triplanes and other early 1900s era aircraft!

Sopwith Pup:

Bristol Boxkite (Converted into a glider)

Can't wait to see what people decide to share!
Me neither, waiting to see what people can make.

I had a lovely biplane with teeny tiny cockpit about a year ago. It's broken now but man it was fun:

Alright, nice builds everyone. I know its not a bi-plane, but it is from the early 1900's, so I'm gonna attempt to build a Fokker Eindecker:

I will post a (Hopefully) finished build soonTM

This should be interesting...
Dude, these are awesome! Points to all the above creations.

So, this is how she turned out:

Not as great, or as easy, as first imagined. Never mind, it can only get better, right?

Alright, nice builds everyone. I know its not a bi-plane, but it is from the early 1900's, so I'm gonna attempt to build a Fokker Eindecker:

http://www.aerospaceweb.org/question/weapons/guns/fokker-eindecker.jpg

I will post a (Hopefully) finished build soonTM

This should be interesting...

Yeeeessssss...

I probably should mention that it is okay to post monoplanes here as long as they are from the prewar/WW1 era. Fokker Eindecker is a great plane to recreate, I tried to build one myself once, but I never finished.

Stock 100% electric triplane from 0.25:

http://i.imgur.com/r4XSW65.png

I know theres a trick that if you hold Q on the propeller and change vessels to the main craft, it gets stuck rotating still. PLEASE dont fix that squad its so helpful. Now with that photo, I feel inspired to do something similar to that because that's way more efficient than cramming engines inside.
Just a little biplane fighter I use as target practice.
It's not based on anything from the early 1900's, but it is a biplane, so hope it's ok to include here. Been in my hangar for a while now as it's quite easy and fun to fly.

It's not based on anything from the early 1900's, but it is a biplane, so hope it's ok to include here. Been in my hangar for a while now as it's quite easy and fun to fly.

http://www.88qv.com/KSP/bipe.jpg

If the Wright Brothers had a jet engine...

If the Wright Brothers had a jet engine...

Yeah, apart from a modded lander capsule, I play stock parts which kind of limits you with regard to motive power. I would have loved to have made this prop driven, but ended up with a shock cone intake at the front that sort of looks like a spinner, and is therefore suggestive of a propeller being up front.

Great job on all your craft everyone!

I've got one. Not based on anything in particular but it's a real sweet clean bird.

Flies super stable. Don't even have to touch the controls and she just lifts off the runway.

Has a small drop tank to extend the range. But if you switch the engine from the KAX rotary to the more efficient two-blade prop it'll go practically forever on a really small amount of fuel. I've flown this thing through the mountain passes west of the KSC. Lots of fun!

And it's robust enough to survive some VERY serious damage! I scraped off all the wing surfaces on the right-hand side of the plane on one of the KSC buildings once and with the help of the reaction wheel and a little bit of luck and skill, actually managed to set it down safely!

Great job on all your craft everyone!

I've got one. Not based on anything in particular but it's a real sweet clean bird.

Very nice, this one. Have some rep! Assuming that's TweakScale used for the drop-tank?
